summary: Interactive romantic-themed single-purpose Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) for iPad Chrome, with Yes/No options where No evades hover and Yes shows a meme image/message.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt screen that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and shows exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".
Implement an evasive "No" option that moves away when the user attempts to interact with it, preventing it from being clicked (support both mouse/trackpad and iPad touch interactions).

When the user clicks "Yes", replace the prompt UI with a result view that displays a meme image containing the text: "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji" (exact casing and spacing preserved as provided), and hide/disable the Yes/No options.

Apply a cohesive romantic theme using a pink-and-white color scheme across the layout, typography, buttons, and background, optimized for iPad Chrome (responsive, centered content, comfortable touch targets).
Add the generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and load it directly from the frontend (do not fetch the image via the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed interactive Valentine web page that asks 'Will you be my Valentine?' with Yes/No options, runnable in iPad Chrome using HTML/CSS/JS.
Make the 'No' option move away on hover so it cannot be clicked (forces clicking 'Yes').
On clicking 'Yes', display a meme image/message: "Good Choice Doctor Zara Ji".
Apply a romantic pink-and-white theme to the page UI.
